docblock.long-description: This class extends Exception to allow for catching PHPSandbox-specific exceptions.

tag.name: author
tag.description: Elijah Horton <fieryprophet@yahoo.com>

docblock.long-description: This class encapsulates the entire functionality of a PHPSandbox so that an end user only has to create a PHPSandbox instance, configure its options, and run their code

tag.name: author
tag.description: Elijah Horton <fieryprophet@yahoo.com>

tag.name: var
tag.description: A bit flag for the import() method, signifies to import all data from a template

tag.name: var
tag.description: A bit flag for the import() method, signifies to import only options from a template

tag.name: var
tag.description: A bit flag for the import() method, signifies to import only definitions from a template

tag.name: var
tag.description: A bit flag for the import() method, signifies to import only whitelists from a template

tag.name: var
tag.description: A bit flag for the import() method, signifies to import only blacklists from a template

tag.name: var
tag.description: A bit flag for the import() method, signifies to import only trusted code from a template

tag.name: var
tag.description: A bit flag for the import() method, signifies to import only sandboxed code from a template

tag.name: var
tag.description: The prefix given to the obfuscated sandbox variable passed to the generated code

tag.name: var
tag.description: A static array of superglobal names used for redefining superglobal values

tag.name: var
tag.description: A static array of magic constant names used for redefining magic constant values

tag.name: var
tag.description: A static array of defined_* and declared_* functions names used for redefining defined_* and declared_* values

tag.name: var
tag.description: A static array of func_get_args, func_get_arg, and func_num_args used for redefining those functions

tag.name: var
tag.description: The randomly generated name of the PHPSandbox variable passed to the generated closure

property.name: $definitions
property.default: array('functions' => array(), 'variables' => array(), 'superglobals' => array(), 'constants' => array(), 'magic_constants' => array(), 'namespaces' => array(), 'aliases' => array())

tag.name: var
tag.description: Array of defined functions, superglobals, etc. If an array type contains elements, then it overwrites its external counterpart

property.name: $whitelist
property.default: array('functions' => array(), 'variables' => array(), 'globals' => array(), 'superglobals' => array(), 'constants' => array(), 'magic_constants' => array(), 'namespaces' => array(), 'aliases' => array(), 'classes' => array(), 'interfaces' => array(), 'traits' => array(), 'keywords' => array(), 'operators' => array(), 'primitives' => array(), 'types' => array())

tag.name: var
tag.description: Array of whitelisted functions, classes, etc. If an array type contains elements, then it overrides its blacklist counterpart

property.name: $blacklist
property.default: array('functions' => array(), 'variables' => array(), 'globals' => array(), 'superglobals' => array(), 'constants' => array(), 'magic_constants' => array(), 'namespaces' => array(), 'aliases' => array(), 'classes' => array(), 'interfaces' => array(), 'traits' => array(), 'keywords' => array('declare' => true, 'include' => true, 'eval' => true, 'exit' => true, 'halt' => true), 'operators' => array(), 'primitives' => array(), 'types' => array())

tag.name: var
tag.description: Array of blacklisted functions, classes, etc. Any whitelisted array types override their counterpart in this array

tag.name: var
tag.description: The error_reporting level to set the PHPSandbox scope to when executing the generated closure, if set to null it will use parent scope error level.

tag.name: var
tag.description: Should PHPSandbox automagically whitelist prepended and appended code?

tag.name: var
tag.description: Should PHPSandbox automagically whitelist functions created in sandboxed code if $allow_functions is true?

tag.name: var
tag.description: Should PHPSandbox automagically whitelist constants created in sandboxed code if $allow_constants is true?

tag.name: var
tag.description: Should PHPSandbox automagically whitelist global variables created in sandboxed code if $allow_globals is true? (Used to whitelist them in the variables list)

tag.name: var
tag.description: Should PHPSandbox automagically whitelist classes created in sandboxed code if $allow_classes is true?

tag.name: var
tag.description: Should PHPSandbox automagically whitelist interfaces created in sandboxed code if $allow_interfaces is true?

tag.name: var
tag.description: Should PHPSandbox automagically whitelist traits created in sandboxed code if $allow_traits is true?

tag.name: var
tag.description: Should PHPSandbox automagically define variables passed to prepended, appended and prepared code closures?

tag.name: var
tag.description: Should PHPSandbox overwrite get_defined_functions, get_defined_vars, get_defined_constants, get_declared_classes, get_declared_interfaces and get_declared_traits?

tag.name: var
tag.description: Should PHPSandbox overwrite func_get_args, func_get_arg and func_num_args?

tag.name: var
tag.description: Should PHPSandbox overwrite $_GET, $_POST, $_COOKIE, $_FILES, $_ENV, $_REQUEST, $_SERVER, $_SESSION and $GLOBALS superglobals? If so, unless alternate superglobal values have been defined they will return as empty arrays.

tag.name: var
tag.description: Should PHPSandbox allow sandboxed code to declare functions?

tag.name: var
tag.description: Should PHPSandbox allow sandboxed code to declare closures?

tag.name: var
tag.description: Should PHPSandbox allow sandboxed code to create variables?

tag.name: var
tag.description: Should PHPSandbox allow sandboxed code to create static variables?

tag.name: var
tag.description: Should PHPSandbox allow sandboxed code to create objects of allow classes (e.g. new keyword)?

tag.name: var
tag.description: Should PHPSandbox allow sandboxed code to define constants?

tag.name: var
tag.description: Should PHPSandbox allow sandboxed code to use global keyword to access variables in the global scope?

tag.name: var
tag.description: Should PHPSandbox allow sandboxed code to declare namespaces (utilizing the define_namespace function?)

tag.name: var
tag.description: Should PHPSandbox allow sandboxed code to use namespaces and declare namespace aliases (utilizing the define_alias function?)

tag.name: var
tag.description: Should PHPSandbox allow sandboxed code to declare classes?

tag.name: var
tag.description: Should PHPSandbox allow sandboxed code to declare interfaces?

tag.name: var
tag.description: Should PHPSandbox allow sandboxed code to declare traits?

tag.name: var
tag.description: Should PHPSandbox allow sandboxed code to escape to HTML?

tag.name: var
tag.description: Should PHPSandbox allow sandboxed code to cast types? (This will still be subject to allowed classes)

tag.name: var
tag.description: Should PHPSandbox allow sandboxed code to suppress errors (e.g. the @ operator?)

tag.name: var
tag.description: Should PHPSandbox allow sandboxed code to assign references?

tag.name: var
tag.description: Should PHPSandbox allow sandboxed code to use backtick execution? (e.g. $var = \`ping google.com\`; This will also be disabled if shell_exec is not whitelisted or if it is blacklisted, and will be converted to a defined shell_exec function call if one is defined)

tag.name: var
tag.description: Should PHPSandbox allow sandboxed code to halt the PHP compiler?

tag.name: var
tag.description: String of prepended code, will be automagically whitelisted for functions, variables, globals, constants, classes, interfaces and traits if $auto_whitelist_trusted_code is true

tag.name: var
tag.description: String of appended code, will be automagically whitelisted for functions, variables, globals, constants, classes, interfaces and traits if $auto_whitelist_trusted_code is true

tag.name: var
tag.description: Float of the number of microseconds it took to prepare the sandbox

tag.name: var
tag.description: Float of the number of microseconds it took to execute the sandbox

tag.name: var
tag.description: String of preparsed code, for debugging and serialization purposes

tag.name: var
tag.description: Array of parsed code broken down into AST tokens, for debugging and serialization purposes

tag.name: var
tag.description: String of prepared code, for debugging and serialization purposes

tag.name: var
tag.description: Array of prepared code broken down into AST tokens, for debugging and serialization purposes

tag.name: var
tag.description: String of generated code, for debugging and serialization purposes

tag.name: var
tag.description: Closure generated by PHPSandbox execution, stored for future executions without the need to reparse and validate the code

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox = new PHPSandbox\PHPSandbox; You can pass optional arrays of predefined functions, variables, etc. to the sandbox through the constructor

tag.name: param
tag.description: Optional array of options to set for the sandbox

tag.name: param
tag.description: Optional array of functions to define for the sandbox

tag.name: param
tag.description: Optional array of variables to define for the sandbox

tag.name: param
tag.description: Optional array of constants to define for the sandbox

tag.name: param
tag.description: Optional array of namespaces to define for the sandbox

tag.name: param
tag.description: Optional array of aliases to define for the sandbox

tag.name: param
tag.description: Optional array of superglobals to define for the sandbox

tag.name: param
tag.description: Optional array of magic constants to define for the sandbox

tag.name: return
tag.description: The returned PHPSandbox variable

docblock.long-description: You can pass optional arrays of predefined functions, variables, etc. to the sandbox through the constructor

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox = PHPSandbox\PHPSandbox::create();

tag.description: Optional array of options to set for the sandbox

tag.description: Optional array of functions to define for the sandbox

tag.name: param
tag.description: Optional array of constants to define for the sandbox

tag.description: Optional array of namespaces to define for the sandbox

tag.description: Optional array of superglobals to define for the sandbox

tag.name: return

docblock.long-description: Besides the code or closure to be executed, you can also pass additional arguments that will overwrite the default values of their respective arguments defined in the code

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox = new PHPSandbox\PHPSandbox; $sandbox(function(){ echo 'Hello world!'; });

tag.name: param
tag.description: The closure, callable or string of code to execute

tag.name: return
tag.description: The output of the executed sandboxed code

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox = new PHPSandbox\PHPSandbox; serialize($sandbox);

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array of property keys to be serialized

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox = unserialize($sandbox_string);

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->import(array('code' => 'echo "Hello World!";'));

tag.name: param
tag.description: The JSON array or string template to import

tag.name: param
tag.description: Binary flags signifying which parts of the JSON template to import

tag.name: throws
tag.description: Throws exception if JSON template could not be imported

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->importJSON(array('code' => 'echo "Hello World!";'));

tag.name: param
tag.description: The JSON array or string template to import

tag.name: param
tag.description: Binary flags signifying which parts of the JSON template to import

tag.name: throws
tag.description: Throws exception if JSON template could not be imported

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

tag.name: return
tag.description: The name of the PHPSandbox variable

docblock.long-description: You can pass an $option name to set to $value, an array of $option names to set to $value, or an associative array of $option names and their values to set.

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->set_option(array('allow_functions' => true));

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->set_option(array('allow_functions', 'allow_classes'), true);

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->set_option('allow_functions', true);

tag.name: param
tag.description: String or array of strings or associative array of keys of option names to set $value to

tag.name: param
tag.description: Boolean, integer or null $value to set $option to (optional)

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

docblock.long-description: You can pass an array of option names to set to $value, or an associative array of option names and their values to set.

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->set_option(array('allow_functions' => true));

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->set_option(array('allow_functions', 'allow_classes'), true);

tag.name: param
tag.description: Array of strings or associative array of keys of option names to set $value to, or JSON array or string template to import

tag.name: param
tag.description: Boolean, integer or null $value to set $option to (optional)

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

tag.name: param
tag.description: String of $option name to get

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the value of the requested option

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns a string of the prepended code

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns a string of the appended code

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns a string of the preparsed code

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns an array of the parsed AST code

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns a string of the prepared code

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns an array of the parsed AST code

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns a string of the generated code

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the generated closure

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the generated closure

docblock.description: Get PHPSandbox redefined functions in place of get_defined_functions().
docblock.long-description: This is an internal PHPSandbox function but requires public access to work.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Array result from get_defined_functions() is passed here

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the redefined functions array

docblock.description: Get PHPSandbox redefined variables in place of get_defined_vars().
docblock.long-description: This is an internal PHPSandbox function but requires public access to work.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Array result from get_defined_vars() is passed here

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the redefined variables array

docblock.long-description: This is an internal PHPSandbox function but requires public access to work.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Requested superglobal name (e.g. _GET, _POST, etc.)

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the redefined superglobal

docblock.long-description: This is an internal PHPSandbox function but requires public access to work.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Requested magic constant name (e.g. __FILE__, __LINE__, etc.)

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the redefined magic constant

docblock.description: Get PHPSandbox redefined constants in place of get_defined_constants().
docblock.long-description: This is an internal PHPSandbox function but requires public access to work.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Array result from get_defined_constants() is passed here

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the redefined constants

docblock.description: Get PHPSandbox redefined classes in place of get_declared_classes().
docblock.long-description: This is an internal PHPSandbox function but requires public access to work.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Array result from get_declared_classes() is passed here

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the redefined classes

tag.name: return

docblock.long-description: This is an internal PHPSandbox function but requires public access to work.

tag.description: Array result from get_declared_traits() is passed here

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the redefined traits

tag.name: param
tag.description: Array result from func_get_args() is passed here

tag.name: return

tag.description: Requested func_get_arg index is passed here

tag.description: Returns the redefined argument

tag.name: param
tag.description: Array result from func_get_args() is passed here

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the redefined number of function arguments

docblock.long-description: This is an internal PHPSandbox function but requires public access to work.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: Will throw exception if invalid function requested

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the redefined function result

docblock.description: Define PHPSandbox definitions, such as functions, constants, namespaces, etc.
docblock.long-description: You can pass a string of the $type, $name and $value, or pass an associative array of definitions types and an associative array of their corresponding values

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->define('functions', 'test', function(){ echo 'test'; });

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->define(array('functions' => array('test' => function(){ echo 'test'; }));

tag.name: param
tag.description: Associative array or string of definition type to define

tag.name: param
tag.description: Associative array or string of definition name to define

tag.name: param
tag.description: Value of definition to define

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

docblock.description: Undefine PHPSandbox definitions, such as functions, constants, namespaces, etc.
docblock.long-description: You can pass a string of the $type and $name to undefine, or pass an associative array of definitions types and an array of key names to undefine

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->undefine('functions', 'test');

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->undefine(array('functions' => array('test'));

tag.name: param
tag.description: Associative array or string of definition type to undefine

tag.name: param
tag.description: Associative array or string of definition name to undefine

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

docblock.long-description: You can pass the function $name and $function closure or callable to define, or an associative array of functions to define, which can have callable values or arrays of the function callable and $pass_sandbox flag

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->define_func('test', function(){ echo 'test'; });

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->define_func(array('test' => function(){ echo 'test'; }));

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->define_func(array('test' => array(function(){ echo 'test'; }, true)));

tag.name: param
tag.description: Associative array or string of function $name to define

tag.name: param
tag.description: Callable to define $function to

tag.name: param
tag.description: Pass PHPSandbox instance to defined function when called? Default is false

tag.name: throws
tag.description: Throws exception if unnamed or uncallable $function is defined

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

docblock.long-description: You can pass an associative array of functions to define

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->define_funcs(array('test' => function(){ echo 'test'; }));

tag.name: param
tag.description: Associative array of $functions to define

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

docblock.description: Query whether PHPSandbox instance has defined functions

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->has_defined_funcs(); //returns number of defined functions, or zero if none defined

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the number of functions this instance has defined

docblock.description: Check if PHPSandbox instance has $name function defined

tag.name: param
tag.description: String of function $name to query

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns true if PHPSandbox instance has defined function, false otherwise

docblock.long-description: You can pass a string of function $name to undefine, or pass an array of function names to undefine

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->undefine_func(array('test', 'test2'));

tag.name: param
tag.description: String of function name or array of function names to undefine

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

docblock.long-description: You can pass an array of function names to undefine, or an empty array or null argument to undefine all functions

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->undefine_funcs(array('test', 'test2'));

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->undefine_funcs(); //WILL UNDEFINE ALL FUNCTIONS!

tag.name: param
tag.description: Array of function names to undefine. Passing an empty array or no argument will result in undefining all functions

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

docblock.long-description: You can pass the variable $name and $value to define, or an associative array of variables to define

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->define_var('test', 1);

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->define_var(array('test' => 1));

tag.name: param
tag.description: String of variable $name or associative array to define

tag.name: param
tag.description: Value to define variable to

tag.name: throws
tag.description: Throws exception if unnamed variable is defined

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

docblock.long-description: You can pass an associative array of variables to define

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->define_vars(array('test' => 1));

tag.name: param
tag.description: Associative array of $variables to define

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

docblock.description: Query whether PHPSandbox instance has defined variables

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->has_defined_vars(); //returns number of defined variables, or zero if none defined

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the number of variables this instance has defined

docblock.description: Check if PHPSandbox instance has $name variable defined

tag.name: param
tag.description: String of variable $name to query

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns true if PHPSandbox instance has defined variable, false otherwise

docblock.long-description: You can pass a string of variable $name to undefine, or an array of variable names to undefine

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->undefine_var(array('test', 'test2'));

tag.name: param
tag.description: String of variable name or an array of variable names to undefine

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

docblock.long-description: You can pass an array of variable names to undefine, or an empty array or null argument to undefine all variables

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->undefine_vars(array('test', 'test2'));

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->undefine_vars(); //WILL UNDEFINE ALL VARIABLES!

tag.name: param
tag.description: Array of variable names to undefine. Passing an empty array or no argument will result in undefining all variables

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

docblock.long-description: You can pass the superglobal $name and $value to define, or an associative array of superglobals to define, or a third variable to define the $key

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->define_superglobal('_GET', array('page' => 1));

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->define_superglobal(array('_GET' => array('page' => 1)));

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->define_superglobal('_GET', 'page', 1);

tag.name: param
tag.description: String of superglobal $name or associative array of superglobal names to define

tag.name: param
tag.description: Value to define superglobal to, can be callable

tag.name: throws
tag.description: Throws exception if unnamed superglobal is defined

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

docblock.long-description: You can pass an associative array of superglobals to define

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->define_superglobals(array('_GET' => array('page' => 1)));

tag.name: param
tag.description: Associative array of $superglobals to define

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

docblock.description: Query whether PHPSandbox instance has defined superglobals, or if superglobal $name has defined keys

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->has_defined_superglobals(); //returns number of defined superglobals, or zero if none defined

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->has_defined_superglobals('_GET'); //returns number of defined superglobal _GET keys, or zero if none defined

tag.name: param
tag.description: String of superglobal $name to check for keys

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the number of superglobals or superglobal keys this instance has defined, or false if invalid superglobal name specified

docblock.description: Check if PHPSandbox instance has $name superglobal defined, or if superglobal $name key is defined

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->is_defined_superglobal('_GET', 'page');

tag.name: param
tag.description: String of superglobal $name to query

tag.name: param
tag.description: String of key to to query in superglobal

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns true if PHPSandbox instance has defined superglobal, false otherwise

docblock.description: Undefine PHPSandbox superglobal or superglobal key
docblock.long-description: You can pass a string of superglobal $name to undefine, or a superglobal $key to undefine, or an array of superglobal names to undefine, or an an associative array of superglobal names and keys to undefine

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->undefine_superglobal('_GET', 'page');

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->undefine_superglobal(array('_GET', '_POST'));

tag.name: param
tag.description: String of superglobal $name, or array of superglobal names, or associative array of superglobal names and keys to undefine

tag.name: param
tag.description: String of superglobal $key to undefine

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

docblock.long-description: You can pass an array of superglobal names to undefine, or an associative array of superglobals names and key to undefine, or an empty array or null to undefine all superglobals

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->undefine_superglobals(array('_GET', '_POST'));

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->undefine_superglobals(array('_GET' => 'page', '_POST' => 'page'));

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->undefine_superglobals(); //WILL UNDEFINE ALL SUPERGLOBALS!

tag.name: param
tag.description: Associative array of superglobal names and keys or array of superglobal names to undefine

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

docblock.long-description: You can pass the constant $name and $value to define, or an associative array of constants to define

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->define_const('TEST', 1);

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->define_const(array('TEST' => 1));

tag.name: param
tag.description: String of constant $name or associative array to define

tag.name: param
tag.description: Value to define constant to

tag.name: throws
tag.description: Throws exception if unnamed constant is defined

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

docblock.long-description: You can pass an associative array of constants to define

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->define_consts(array('test' => 1));

tag.name: param
tag.description: Associative array of $constants to define

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

docblock.description: Query whether PHPSandbox instance has defined constants

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->has_defined_consts(); //returns number of defined constants, or zero if none defined

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the number of constants this instance has defined

docblock.description: Check if PHPSandbox instance has $name constant defined

tag.name: param
tag.description: String of constant $name to query

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns true if PHPSandbox instance has defined constant, false otherwise

docblock.long-description: You can pass a string of constant $name to undefine, or an array of constant names to undefine

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->undefine_const(array('test', 'test2'));

tag.name: param
tag.description: String of constant name or array of constant names to undefine

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

docblock.long-description: You can pass an array of constant names to undefine, or an empty array or null argument to undefine all constants

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->undefine_consts(array('test', 'test2'));

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->undefine_consts(); //WILL UNDEFINE ALL CONSTANTS!

tag.name: param
tag.description: Array of constant names to undefine. Passing an empty array or no argument will result in undefining all constants

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

docblock.long-description: You can pass the magic constant $name and $value to define, or an associative array of magic constants to define

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->define_magic_const('__LINE__', 1);

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->define_magic_const(array('__LINE__' => 1));

tag.name: param
tag.description: String of magic constant $name or associative array to define

tag.name: param
tag.description: Value to define magic constant to, can be callable

tag.name: throws
tag.description: Throws exception if unnamed magic constant is defined

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

docblock.description: Define PHPSandbox magic constants by array
docblock.long-description: You can pass an associative array of magic constants to define

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->define_magic_consts(array('__LINE__' => 1));

tag.name: param
tag.description: Associative array of $magic_constants to define

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

docblock.description: Query whether PHPSandbox instance has defined magic constants

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->has_defined_magic_consts(); //returns number of defined magic constants, or zero if none defined

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the number of magic constants this instance has defined

docblock.description: Check if PHPSandbox instance has $name magic constant defined

tag.name: param
tag.description: String of magic constant $name to query

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns true if PHPSandbox instance has defined magic constant, false otherwise

docblock.long-description: You can pass an a string of magic constant $name to undefine, or array of magic constant names to undefine

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->undefine_magic_const(array('__LINE__', '__FILE__'));

tag.name: param
tag.description: String of magic constant name, or array of magic constant names to undefine

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

docblock.description: Undefine PHPSandbox magic constants by array
docblock.long-description: You can pass an array of magic constant names to undefine, or an empty array or null argument to undefine all magic constants

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->undefine_magic_consts(array('__LINE__', '__FILE__'));

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->undefine_magic_consts(); //WILL UNDEFINE ALL MAGIC CONSTANTS!

tag.name: param
tag.description: Array of magic constant names to undefine. Passing an empty array or no argument will result in undefining all magic constants

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

docblock.long-description: You can pass the namespace $name and $value to define, or an array of namespaces to define

tag.description: String of namespace $name, or an array of namespace names to define

tag.description: Throws exception if unnamed namespace is defined

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

tag.description: $sandbox->define_namespaces(array('Foo', 'Bar'));

tag.description: Array of $namespaces to define

tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

docblock.description: Query whether PHPSandbox instance has defined namespaces

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->has_defined_namespaces(); //returns number of defined namespaces, or zero if none defined

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the number of namespaces this instance has defined

docblock.description: Check if PHPSandbox instance has $name namespace defined

tag.name: param
tag.description: String of namespace $name to query

tag.description: Returns true if PHPSandbox instance has defined namespace, false otherwise

docblock.long-description: You can pass a string of namespace $name to undefine, or an array of namespace names to undefine

tag.description: String of namespace $name, or an array of namespace names to undefine

tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

docblock.long-description: You can pass an array of namespace names to undefine, or an empty array or null argument to undefine all namespaces

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->undefine_namespaces(array('Foo', 'Bar'));

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->undefine_namespaces(); //WILL UNDEFINE ALL NAMESPACES!

tag.name: param
tag.description: Array of namespace names to undefine. Passing an empty array or no argument will result in undefining all namespaces

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

docblock.long-description: You can pass the namespace $name and $alias to use, an array of namespaces to use, or an associative array of namespaces to use and their aliases

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->define_alias('Foo'); //use Foo;

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->define_alias('Foo', 'Bar'); //use Foo as Bar;

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->define_alias(array('Foo', 'Bar')); //use Foo; use Bar;

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->define_alias(array('Foo' => 'Bar')); //use Foo as Bar;

tag.name: param
tag.description: String of namespace $name to use, or or an array of namespaces to use, or an associative array of namespaces and their aliases to use

tag.name: param
tag.description: String of $alias to use

tag.name: throws
tag.description: Throws exception if unnamed namespace is used

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

docblock.long-description: You can pass an array of namespaces to use, or an associative array of namespaces to use and their aliases

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->define_aliases(array('Foo', 'Bar')); //use Foo; use Bar;

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->define_aliases(array('Foo' => 'Bar')); //use Foo as Bar;

tag.name: param
tag.description: Array of namespaces to use, or an associative array of namespaces and their aliases to use

tag.name: throws
tag.description: Throws exception if unnamed namespace is used

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->has_defined_aliases(); //returns number of defined aliases, or zero if none defined

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the number of aliases this instance has defined

tag.name: param
tag.description: String of alias $name to query

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns true if PHPSandbox instance has defined aliases, false otherwise

docblock.long-description: You can pass a string of alias $name to undefine, or an array of alias names to undefine

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->undefine_alias(array('Foo', 'Bar'));

tag.name: param
tag.description: String of alias name, or array of alias names to undefine

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

docblock.long-description: You can pass an array of alias names to undefine, or an empty array or null argument to undefine all aliases

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->undefine_aliases(array('Foo', 'Bar'));

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->undefine_aliases(); //WILL UNDEFINE ALL ALIASES!

tag.name: param
tag.description: Array of alias names to undefine. Passing an empty array or no argument will result in undefining all aliases

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

tag.name: alias
tag.description: define_alias(); You can pass the namespace $name and $alias to use, an array of namespaces to use, or an associative array of namespaces to use and their aliases

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->define_use('Foo'); //use Foo;

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->define_use('Foo', 'Bar'); //use Foo as Bar;

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->define_use(array('Foo', 'Bar')); //use Foo; use Bar;

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->define_use(array('Foo' => 'Bar')); //use Foo as Bar;

tag.name: param
tag.description: String of namespace $name to use, or or an array of namespaces to use, or an associative array of namespaces and their aliases to use

tag.name: param
tag.description: String of $alias to use

tag.name: throws
tag.description: Throws exception if unnamed namespace is used

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

docblock.description: Define PHPSandbox uses (or aliases) by array

tag.name: alias
tag.description: define_aliases(); You can pass an array of namespaces to use, or an associative array of namespaces to use and their aliases

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->define_uses(array('Foo', 'Bar')); //use Foo; use Bar;

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->define_uses(array('Foo' => 'Bar')); //use Foo as Bar;

tag.name: param
tag.description: Array of namespaces to use, or an associative array of namespaces and their aliases to use

tag.name: throws
tag.description: Throws exception if unnamed namespace is used

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

docblock.description: Query whether PHPSandbox instance has defined uses (or aliases)

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->has_defined_uses(); //returns number of defined uses (or aliases) or zero if none defined

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the number of uses (or aliases) this instance has defined

docblock.description: Check if PHPSandbox instance has $name uses (or alias) defined

tag.name: param
tag.description: String of use (or alias) $name to query

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns true if PHPSandbox instance has defined uses (or aliases) and false otherwise

docblock.long-description: You can pass a string of use (or alias) $name to undefine, or an array of use (or alias) names to undefine

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->undefine_use(array('Foo', 'Bar'));

tag.name: param
tag.description: String of use (or alias) name, or array of use (or alias) names to undefine

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

docblock.description: Undefine PHPSandbox uses (or aliases) by array

tag.name: alias
tag.description: undefine_aliases(); You can pass an array of use (or alias) names to undefine, or an empty array or null argument to undefine all uses (or aliases)

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->undefine_uses(array('Foo', 'Bar'));

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->undefine_uses(); //WILL UNDEFINE ALL USES (OR ALIASES!)

tag.name: param
tag.description: Array of use (or alias) names to undefine. Passing an empty array or no argument will result in undefining all uses (or aliases)

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

docblock.description: Whitelist PHPSandbox definitions, such as functions, constants, classes, etc.
docblock.long-description:
to set

You can pass an associative array of whitelist types and their names, or a string $type and array of $names, or pass a string of the $type and $name

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->whitelist(array('functions' => array('test')));

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->whitelist('functions', array('test'));

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->whitelist('functions', 'test');

tag.name: param
tag.description: Associative array or string of whitelist type to set

tag.name: param
tag.description: Array or string of whitelist name to set

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

docblock.description: Blacklist PHPSandbox definitions, such as functions, constants, classes, etc.
docblock.long-description:
to set

You can pass an associative array of blacklist types and their names, or a string $type and array of $names, or pass a string of the $type and $name

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->blacklist(array('functions' => array('test')));

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->blacklist('functions', array('test'));

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->blacklist('functions', 'test');

tag.name: param
tag.description: Associative array or string of blacklist type to set

tag.name: param
tag.description: Array or string of blacklist name to set

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

docblock.description: Remove PHPSandbox definitions, such as functions, constants, classes, etc.
docblock.long-description:
from whitelist

You can pass an associative array of whitelist types and their names, or a string $type and array of $names, or pass a string of the $type and $name to unset

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->dewhitelist(array('functions' => array('test')));

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->dewhitelist('functions', array('test'));

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->dewhitelist('functions', 'test');

tag.name: param
tag.description: Associative array or string of whitelist type to unset

tag.name: param
tag.description: Array or string of whitelist name to unset

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the PHPSandbox instance for chainability

docblock.long-description: This function validates your code and automatically whitelists it according to your specified configuration

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->prepare(function(){ var_dump('Hello world!'); });

tag.name: param
tag.description: The callable to prepare for execution

tag.name: throws
tag.description: Throws exception if error occurs in parsing, validation or whitelisting

tag.name: return
tag.description: The prepared closure (this can also be accessed via $sandbox->generated_closure)

docblock.description: Prepare and execute callable and return output
docblock.long-description: This function validates your code and automatically whitelists it according to your specified configuration, then executes it. You can also pass an unlimited number of arguments to override variables configured in the function. If the first argument is not callable and a valid generated closure exists, then all arguments are passed to the executed code

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->execute(function(){ var_dump('Hello world!'); });

tag.name: example
tag.description: $sandbox->execute(function($test){ var_dump($test); }, 'Hello world!'); //Hello world!

tag.name: throws
tag.description: Throws exception if error occurs in parsing, validation or whitelisting or if generated closure is invalid

tag.name: return
tag.description: The output from the executed sandboxed code

docblock.long-description: This class takes parsed AST code and checks it against the passed PHPSandbox instance configuration to autmatically whitelist sandboxed code functions, classes, etc. if the appropriate settings are configured.

tag.name: author
tag.description: Elijah Horton <fieryprophet@yahoo.com>

docblock.description: The PHPSandbox instance to check against

docblock.long-description: This constructor takes a passed PHPSandbox instance to check against for whitelisting sandboxed code.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The PHPSandbox instance to check against

docblock.description: Examine the current PHPParser_Node node against the PHPSandbox configuration for whitelisting sandboxed code

tag.name: param
tag.description: The sandboxed $node to examine

docblock.long-description: This class takes parsed AST code and checks it against the passed PHPSandbox instance configuration for errors, and throws exceptions if they are found

tag.name: author
tag.description: Elijah Horton <fieryprophet@yahoo.com>

tag.description: The sandboxed $node to validate

tag.description: Throws an exception if validation fails

tag.name: return
tag.description: Return rewritten node, false if node must be removed, or null if no changes to the node are made

docblock.description: Test the current PHPParser_Node node to see if it is a magic constant, and return the name if it is and null if it is not

tag.name: param
tag.description: The sandboxed $node to test

tag.name: return
tag.description: Return string name of node, or null if it is not a magic constant

docblock.description: Test the current PHPParser_Node node to see if it is a keyword, and return the name if it is and null if it is not

tag.name: param
tag.description: The sandboxed $node to test

tag.name: return
tag.description: Return string name of node, or null if it is not a keyword

docblock.description: Test the current PHPParser_Node node to see if it is an operator, and return the name if it is and null if it is not

tag.name: param
tag.description: The sandboxed $node to test

tag.name: return
tag.description: Return string name of node, or null if it is not an operator

docblock.description: Test the current PHPParser_Node node to see if it is a primitive, and return the name if it is and null if it is not

tag.name: param
tag.description: The sandboxed $node to test

tag.name: throws
tag.description: Throws exception if $node attempts to cast when $allow_casting is false in the PHPSandbox configuration

tag.name: return
tag.description: Return string name of node, or null if it is not a primitive
